name.title: Service name
name.description: The name of the service instance

user.description: The user that runs the Portworx tasks.

principal.title: Custom principal (optional)
principal.description: The principal for the service instance, or empty to use the default.

pre_reserved_role.title: Pre-reserved role (optional)
pre_reserved_role.description: The pre-reserved role to use for the tasks

secret_name.title: Credential secret name (optional)
secret_name.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

mesos_api_version.description: Configures the Mesos API version to use. Possible values: V0 (non-HTTP), V1 (HTTP)

portworx_port_range_start.title: Portworx port range start
portworx_port_range_start.description: Port number from which Portworx will start consuming ports. Cannot be updated once deployed.

kvdb_servers.title: KVDB servers
kvdb_servers.description: Comma seperated IP:PORT entries for the key value database (etcd or consul). If the etcd server is started using the pacakge this will be ignored

container_parameters.title: Container parameters
container_parameters.description: Any additional paramters to pass in to the Portworx container. For example environment variables can be passed in using "-e"

count.title: Node count
count.description: Number of Portworx nodes to run

placement_constraint.title: Placement constraint
placement_constraint.description: Marathon-style placement constraint for nodes. Example: 'hostname:UNIQUE'

secrets.description:
Use DC/OS Secrets for features like volume encryption, cloudsnap authentication, etc. This should be enabled only for DC/OS Enterprise edition. 
Note: DC/OS Secrets will only be supported from Portworx version 1.4

enabled.title: Enable DC/OS secrets
enabled.description: If enabled, provide valid credentials below, so that Portworx can access the secrets as needed

base_path.title: Secrets base path
base_path.description: The secrets base path that is accessible to Portworx (DC/OS user provided to access secrets) for reading and writing secrets. If not provided, Portworx will look for secrets at the top level

dcos_username_secret.title: DC/OS username secret
dcos_username_secret.description: Secret path containing the username of the DC/OS user who has permissions to access the secrets under the secrets base path. Eg. portworx/dcos_username

dcos_password_secret.title: DC/OS password secret
dcos_password_secret.description: Secret path containing the password of the DC/OS user who has permissions to access the secrets under the secrets base path. Eg. portworx/dcos_password

etcd.description: Start a 3 node etcd cluster. Required for Portworx if you don't have either etcd or consul already running. For production it is recommended to run an etcd cluster outside your DC/OS cluster.

enabled.title: Start etcd
enabled.description: If disabled, please enter the external etcd server IP on the service tab.

proxy_enabled.title: Start the etcd proxy
proxy_enabled.description: Enable if you had installed an older version of the framework which had the etcd proxy. Not required for newer installations.

placement_constraint.title: Placement constraint
placement_constraint.description: Marathon-style placement constraint for nodes. Example: 'hostname:UNIQUE'

disk_type.title: Type of disk to use for persisting data

node_advertise_port.title: Cluster Node advertise port
node_advertise_port.description: Port on which the etcd cluster nodes will listen

node_peer_port.title: Cluster Node peer port
node_peer_port.description: Port on which the etcd cluster nodes will communicate with each other

proxy_advertise_port.title: Cluster Proxy advertise port
proxy_advertise_port.description: Port on which the etcd proxy will listen

lighthouse.description:
Lighthouse exposes the web UI for Portworx. Start this if you don't want to connect to the central Portworx Lighthouse. 
Note: Lighthouse will work only with Portworx 1.4 and above

enabled.title: Start Lighthouse
enabled.description: Start the Lighthouse service. If this is disabled the influxdb service will also be disabled.

placement_constraint.title: Placement constraint
placement_constraint.description: Marathon-style placement constraint for nodes. Example: 'hostname:UNIQUE'

public_agent.title: public_agent
public_agent.description: Whether to run Lighthouse on a public agent or not. If you do not have a public agent, disable this option to run on a private agent. Remember, this cannot be changed once the framework is deployed.

webui_port.title: WebUI Port
webui_port.description: Port on which Lighthouse can be accessed

company_name.title: Company Name
company_name.description: Company Name to use for creating Lighthouse account

admin_username.title: Administrator username
admin_username.description: Username to use for the Lighthouse account. This cannot be changed later.
